Mana Potion

A Mana Potion is a magical consumable item that restores the drinker's spiritual energy, allowing them to cast more spells.

Description

Mana Potions restore magical energy, which is required for casting spells and using certain magical abilities. They are particularly valuable for spellcasters and magic-focused characters.

Effect

  • Restores: 1/3 of maximum skill points (mana)
  • Usage: Consumed when the player has mana-based abilities
  • Benefit: Allows continued use of magical abilities and spells
  • Single use item

Special Properties

  • Restores 1/3 of maximum skill points
  • Can be consumed to replenish magical energy reserves
  • Single use item
  • Takes 4 turns to consume (TIME_TO_DRINK constant)

Additional Usage

To use a Mana Potion, select the “DRINK” action. The potion will restore 1/3 of your maximum skill points.

Obtaining Mana Potions

Mana Potions can be obtained through:

  • Finding them in dungeon levels
  • Purchasing from shops
  • Brewing at alchemy pots (if the recipe is known)
  • As rewards from quests or NPCs

Price

  • 100 gold per potion

Related Items

  • Mana - The resource that these potions restore
  • Spell Book - Items that use mana
  • Spells - Abilities that consume mana
  • Tome of Knowledge - May increase mana capacity

Classes That Benefit

  • Mages - Primary users of mana-based abilities
  • Necromancers - Use souls/mana for necromancy
  • Other magic-using classes

Notes

Mana Potions are essential for spellcasters who rely on magical abilities that consume skill points (mana). They're particularly important for classes like Mages and Necromancers who use mana for their special abilities.
